name: Flareon
disruptions:
Board: Flareons and Eevees on Row 1, 3, 4, 6. On 3 and 4, they are in Barriers
Initial Disruption: None
Timer Disruption: None
recommendedParty:
[Any]

Carbink, Aerodactyl,
Aurorus, Donphan

Swampert, Suicune
clearingStrategy:
Switch B5 to E5. Then B2 to E2.
The Flareons and Eevees will match
itself after this
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 3 moves left
You may fall short in the Clearing
Strategy if you dont have high enough
power. Add Move+5 if you want
mobileNotes:
Same strategy. Catch rate becomes less half per
move which hurts.

name: Swalot
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Rocks every 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
Very easy stage. Mega Slowbro will
get through this stage
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Your team can do this

name: Gengar
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Barriers in 3rd and 4th Column
Timer: Adds 4 Haunter after 2 turns. Add Barriers in the 3rd and 4th. Column after 2 turns. Repeat
clearingStrategy:
A really hard stage. Use a Disruption
Delay in here to get its Hit Points
lower before it can add barriers in
the field
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Do this when you have Zoroark and Mega
Gengar. Move+5 (Optional) and Disruption
Delay will do this (also make sure that you
have Haunter in your team)
notes:
Even though it has an atrocious 
catch, make sure to catch it before
advancing.
mobileNotes:
Higher HP (7819) so this one would be more
difficult to defeat than 3ds version. The catch
rate from 3ds version (which was already low)
was half in this version and you'll rely on Super
Catch Rate to catch this one. You'll want to
catch this one before moving on as this Pokemon
is very helpful on most stages

name: Zoroark
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds Columns of Metal Blocks on 3rd and 4th Column
Timer: Adds 2 Zorua after a turn x2. Adds Columns of Metal Blocks on 3rd and 4th Column after 3 turns. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Any]/[Heracross]

Masquerain, Azumarill,
Slurpuff, Scyther,
Heracross, Sawk,
Mienshao

Xerneas, Lucario
clearingStrategy:
You can Brute Force this stage with
Mega Audino/Mega Kangakhan/Mega
Altaria or use a Disruption Delay to
get its Hit Points lower first before the 
disruptions

For those who are using M-Lucario,
it can't do any good clearing unless
you use a DD (or a Zorua replacing
a Metal Block and you switch a Lucario
there). Better use any of the 3
above
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left
Buy a Disruption Delay and Move+5 with
a decent team
mobileNotes:
Higher HP (5274) which is about 500 more
from 3ds version. Easy to beat but the catch
rate was very low and needs multiple attempt
to catch this. Again, just rely on Super Catch
Rate (Sadly, no Great Ball Reset on this version)

name: Ampharos
disruptions:
Board: Checkered Barriers on Whole board
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Flaaffy after 15 turns. Adds 5 Flaaffy every 3 turns.
recommendedParty:
[Any]/[Garchomp]

Donphan, Phanpy,
Cubone, Marowak,
Stunfisk, Donphan

None
clearingStrategy:
The best grinding place so far.
Focus on clearing the barrier first. Make
sure to completely thaw everything
before 15 turns
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 25 moves left
You'll eventually S-Ranked this stage while
grinding
notes:
If you are having trouble leveling
up pokemons, bring them here with
a decent team (at least 2 Super
Effectives for now)

M-Garchomp can bring 3 NVE
Pokemon with it as long as you
match all Garchomp tiles

Also since you already catch 
Ampharos, you can now use its
Mega Stone
mobileNotes:
Your main grinding stage here. This stage now
only gives 45 EXP per clear instead of the 50
on 3ds version which hurts as EXP grinding
will take longer. No real change apart from that

name: Chandelure
disruptions:
Board: 4 Litwick in Barrier at the lower left
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Lampent over the 4 Litwick after 2 turns. Adds 4 Chandelure over the 4. Lampent after 3 turns
clearingStrategy:
Nothing unusual here. The disruption
act as a "countdown" and nothing
can be done beside carrying Litwick
with you. Keep on comboing to
clear the stage
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 3 moves left
Move+5 will S-Rank this automatically
Your team can do it even without it

name: Mega Gengar
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds Barrier on 3rd and 4th Column after 3 turns. Adds 1 Haunter after a turn x3. Repeat

Added Support: Eevee
clearingStrategy:
Can be pretty hard without items.
This is doable with just DD if
you are low in cash
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left
Move+5 + Disruption Delay with a Mega
Gengar Team will do this if you are lucky
with combos. If not, a Complexity may be
added

With the addition of Giratina and other
event Pokemon, this will be easy with
just DD
notes: We got our 10th Mega Stone here
ability: Mega Effects: Erases all of this Pok√©mon in the puzzle area.
